info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:56AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN OTTAWA COUNTY THROUGH 430 AM CDT... At 355 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southwest of Quapaw, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Baxter Springs... Commerce... Quapaw... Wyandotte... Treece... Picher... Ottawa... Peoria... Cardin... Twin Bridges State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 306 and 322. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
